title: Hybrid unadjusted Langevin methods for high-dimensional latent variable models. (arXiv:2306.14445v1 [econ.EM])
abstract: The exact estimation of latent variable models with big data is known to be challenging. The latents have to be integrated out numerically, and the dimension of the latent variables increases with the sample size. This paper develops a novel approximate Bayesian method based on the Langevin diffusion process. The method employs the Fisher identity to integrate out the latent variables, which makes it accurate and computationally feasible when applied to big data. In contrast to other approximate estimation methods, it does not require the choice of a parametric distribution for the unknowns, which often leads to inaccuracies. In an empirical discrete choice example with a million observations, the proposed method accurately estimates the posterior choice probabilities using only 2% of the computation time of exact MCMC.

translated_title: 高维潜变量模型的混合未调整 Langevin 方法
translated_abstract: 估计带有大数据的潜变量模型是很具有挑战性的。潜变量需要进行数值积分，并且随着样本大小的增加，潜变量的维数也会增加。本文基于 Langevin 扩散过程开发了一种新的近似贝叶斯方法。该方法利用 Fisher 恒等式积分掉了潜变量，这使得当应用于大数据时它既准确又计算可行。与其他近似估计方法不同，它不需要选择未知参数的参数分布，这往往会导致不准确性。在一个拥有一百万个观测值的离散选择实例中，该方法只使用了精确 MCMC 计算时间的 2％，却精确地估计了后验选择概率。
tldr: 本文提出了一种用于大数据的近似贝叶斯方法，基于 Langevin 扩散过程，使用 Fisher 恒等式积分掉了潜变量，不需要选择未知参数的参数分布，并在离散选择实例中进行了验证。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel approximate Bayesian method based on the Langevin diffusion process for big data latent variable models. The method employs the Fisher identity to integrate out latent variables and does not require choosing a parametric distribution. In an empirical example, it accurately estimates posterior choice probabilities using only 2% of the computation time of exact MCMC.
